<item><title>Top Hezbollah commander killed in Syria</title><description><p><a href="https://news.yahoo.com/lebanons-hezbollah-says-top-commander-killed-israeli-air-022259134.html"><img src="https://s.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/K3jgwXeqRTCu26WEQWdTjg--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/Reuters/2016-05-13T022259Z_1_LYNXNPEC4C02L_RTROPTP_2_LEBANON-HARIRI-INVESTIGATION.JPG" width="130" height="86" alt="A combination picture of Mustafa Amine Badreddine, one of four men wanted for the assassination of Lebanon&#039;s assassinated former prime minister Rafik al-Hariri, is shown in this undated handout picture released at the Special Tribunal for Lebanon website" align="left" title="A combination picture of Mustafa Amine Badreddine, one of four men wanted for the assassination of Lebanon&#039;s assassinated former prime minister Rafik al-Hariri, is shown in this undated handout picture released at the Special Tribunal for Lebanon website" border="0" /></a>By Tom Perry and Laila Bassam BEIRUT (Reuters) - Top Hezbollah commander Mustafa Badreddine has been killed in an attack in Syria, the Lebanese Shi&#039;ite group said on Friday, the biggest blow to the Iranian-backed organization since its military chief was killed in 2008. Badreddine, 55, was one of the highest ranking officials in the group, and assessed by the U.S. government to be responsible for Hezbollah&#039;s military operations in Syria, where it is fighting alongside the Syrian President Bashar al-Assad. The killing of Badreddine, a brother-in-law of the late Hezbollah military commander, Imad Moughniyah, is the latest big loss sustained by Hezbollah and Iran in Syria despite Russian military intervention in support of Assad and his allies.</p><br clear="all"/></description><link>https://news.yahoo.com/lebanons-hezbollah-says-top-commander-killed-israeli-air-022259134.html</link><pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 02:31:12 -0400</pubDate><source url="http://www.reuters.com/">Reuters</source><guid isPermaLink="false">lebanons-hezbollah-says-top-commander-killed-israeli-air-022259134</guid><media:content url="https://s.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/K3jgwXeqRTCu26WEQWdTjg--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/Reuters/2016-05-13T022259Z_1_LYNXNPEC4C02L_RTROPTP_2_LEBANON-HARIRI-INVESTIGATION.JPG" type="image/jpeg" width="130" height="86"></media:content><media:text type="html"><p><a href="https://news.yahoo.com/lebanons-hezbollah-says-top-commander-killed-israeli-air-022259134.html"><img src="https://s.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/K3jgwXeqRTCu26WEQWdTjg--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/Reuters/2016-05-13T022259Z_1_LYNXNPEC4C02L_RTROPTP_2_LEBANON-HARIRI-INVESTIGATION.JPG" width="130" height="86" alt="A combination picture of Mustafa Amine Badreddine, one of four men wanted for the assassination of Lebanon&#039;s assassinated former prime minister Rafik al-Hariri, is shown in this undated handout picture released at the Special Tribunal for Lebanon website" align="left" title="A combination picture of Mustafa Amine Badreddine, one of four men wanted for the assassination of Lebanon&#039;s assassinated former prime minister Rafik al-Hariri, is shown in this undated handout picture released at the Special Tribunal for Lebanon website" border="0" /></a>By Tom Perry and Laila Bassam BEIRUT (Reuters) - Top Hezbollah commander Mustafa Badreddine has been killed in an attack in Syria, the Lebanese Shi&#039;ite group said on Friday, the biggest blow to the Iranian-backed organization since its military chief was killed in 2008. Badreddine, 55, was one of the highest ranking officials in the group, and assessed by the U.S. government to be responsible for Hezbollah&#039;s military operations in Syria, where it is fighting alongside the Syrian President Bashar al-Assad. The killing of Badreddine, a brother-in-law of the late Hezbollah military commander, Imad Moughniyah, is the latest big loss sustained by Hezbollah and Iran in Syria despite Russian military intervention in support of Assad and his allies.</p><br clear="all"/></media:text><media:credit role="publishing company"></media:credit></item><item><title>Syrian Observatory: air strike kills 16 Nusra militants</title><description>BEIRUT (Reuters) - An air strike hit a Nusra Front meeting in northwestern Syria, killing 16 senior members of the al Qaeda-linked group, the Syrian Observatory for Human Rights said on Friday. It was not clear if the air strike, targeting the disused Abu al-Duhour air base, had been carried out by Russia or the United States, which have both mounted strikes against the group in Syria, said Observatory Director Rami Abdulrahman. He said the air base had been heavily bombed in the attack. (Writing by Tom Perry; editing by John Stonestreet)</description><link>https://news.yahoo.com/syrian-observatory-air-strike-kills-16-nusra-militants-070927128.html</link><pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 03:09:27 -0400</pubDate><source url="http://www.reuters.com/">Reuters</source><guid isPermaLink="false">syrian-observatory-air-strike-kills-16-nusra-militants-070927128</guid></item><item><title>Turkish military says 15 PKK militants killed in southeast: NTV</title><description>ISTANBUL (Reuters) - Fifteen militants of the outlawed Kurdistan Workers Party (PKK) were killed in clashes in Turkey's southeastern Sirnak province, broadcaster NTV reported, citing the Turkish military. Turkey has been clashing with militants in sweeps across the southeast, which has seen some of the worst fighting since the height of the insurgency in the 1990s. (Writing by Seda Sezer; Editing by David Dolan)</description><link>https://news.yahoo.com/turkish-military-says-eight-soldiers-six-pkk-militants-061245026.html</link><pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 02:48:35 -0400</pubDate><source url="http://www.reuters.com/">Reuters</source><guid isPermaLink="false">turkish-military-says-eight-soldiers-six-pkk-militants-061245026</guid></item><item><title>China, U.S. should manage South China Sea differences constructively: Chinese general</title><description><p><a href="https://news.yahoo.com/china-u-manage-south-china-sea-differences-constructively-020013542.html"><img src="https://s.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/lADpZE7N47x6zKFxhR0oPA--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/Reuters/2016-05-13T020013Z_1_LYNXNPEC4C02B_RTROPTP_2_VIETNAM-CHINA-SPRATLY.JPG" width="130" height="86" alt="A patrol bock is seen on Da Tay island in the Spratly archipelago" align="left" title="A patrol bock is seen on Da Tay island in the Spratly archipelago" border="0" /></a>China and the United States should manage their differences over disputed waters in the South China Sea constructively, one of China&#039;s top military officials has said. Fang Fenghui, a member of China&#039;s Central Military Commission, told General Joseph Dunford, chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff, the two sides should &quot;refrain from actions detrimental to the relations between the two countries and the two militaries&quot;, state news agency Xinhua reported on Friday. Fang and Dunford discussed the South China Sea in a video link-up on Thursday, it said.</p><br clear="all"/></description><link>https://news.yahoo.com/china-u-manage-south-china-sea-differences-constructively-020013542.html</link><pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 00:13:37 -0400</pubDate><source url="http://www.reuters.com/">Reuters</source><guid isPermaLink="false">china-u-manage-south-china-sea-differences-constructively-020013542</guid><media:content url="https://s.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/lADpZE7N47x6zKFxhR0oPA--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/Reuters/2016-05-13T020013Z_1_LYNXNPEC4C02B_RTROPTP_2_VIETNAM-CHINA-SPRATLY.JPG" type="image/jpeg" width="130" height="86"></media:content><media:text type="html"><p><a href="https://news.yahoo.com/china-u-manage-south-china-sea-differences-constructively-020013542.html"><img src="https://s.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/lADpZE7N47x6zKFxhR0oPA--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/Reuters/2016-05-13T020013Z_1_LYNXNPEC4C02B_RTROPTP_2_VIETNAM-CHINA-SPRATLY.JPG" width="130" height="86" alt="A patrol bock is seen on Da Tay island in the Spratly archipelago" align="left" title="A patrol bock is seen on Da Tay island in the Spratly archipelago" border="0" /></a>China and the United States should manage their differences over disputed waters in the South China Sea constructively, one of China&#039;s top military officials has said. Fang Fenghui, a member of China&#039;s Central Military Commission, told General Joseph Dunford, chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff, the two sides should &quot;refrain from actions detrimental to the relations between the two countries and the two militaries&quot;, state news agency Xinhua reported on Friday. Fang and Dunford discussed the South China Sea in a video link-up on Thursday, it said.</p><br clear="all"/></media:text><media:credit role="publishing company"></media:credit></item><item><title>Shooting in northern Iraqi town kills 12 - police, hospital sources</title><description>Three gunmen opened fire overnight on a cafe in northern Iraq where young men had gathered at the start of the weekend holiday, killing at least 12 and wounding 25, police and hospital sources said on Friday. The assailants in the mainly Shi'ite town of Balad, 80 km (50 miles) north of Baghdad, sprayed machine gun fire from their cars for around 10 minutes before speeding off. The area, which was nearly overrun by Islamic State militants in 2014 and remains around 40 km from a frontline held by Shi'ite militiamen, is heavily secured.</description><link>https://news.yahoo.com/shooting-northern-iraqi-town-kills-12-police-hospital-055932026.html</link><pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 02:19:38 -0400</pubDate><source url="http://www.reuters.com/">Reuters</source><guid isPermaLink="false">shooting-northern-iraqi-town-kills-12-police-hospital-055932026</guid></item><item><title>War on Islamist militants tests Tunisia's young democracy</title><description><p><a href="https://news.yahoo.com/war-islamist-militants-tests-tunisias-young-democracy-061715283.html"><img src="https://s1.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/VCzKWZ_Qtz7T1QfF51oYqg--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/Reuters/2016-05-13T061715Z_1007000001_LYNXNPEC4C088_RTROPTP_2_CNEWS-US-TUNISIA-DEMOCRACY-INSIGHT.JPG" width="130" height="86" alt="Sofiane Melliti, 38, a Tunisian soccer player who says he has been harassed by authorities because of suspected ties to militant attacks, poses for a photograph in Tunis" align="left" title="Sofiane Melliti, 38, a Tunisian soccer player who says he has been harassed by authorities because of suspected ties to militant attacks, poses for a photograph in Tunis" border="0" /></a>Four days after Islamist militants shot dead 21 tourists in Tunisia&#039;s Bardo museum last year, police rounded up dozens of people suspected of links with the gunmen.    One of the men, a laborer, was arrested in his Tunis home. &quot;I thought I didn&#039;t have any other way out.&quot;    Several recent cases of police abuse – which the Tunisian government acknowledges still sometimes occurs – underscore the difficult path Tunisia is treading as it tries to both nurture the young democracy it founded after the 2011 revolution and simultaneously fight Islamist militants.     Like France, Belgium and other victims of Islamist bombings and attacks, Tunisia is trying to figure out how to protect people while also protecting their rights.      That process is even more difficult in a country where the security services themselves are trying to emerge from a history as abusers.</p><br clear="all"/></description><link>https://news.yahoo.com/war-islamist-militants-tests-tunisias-young-democracy-061715283.html</link><pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 02:17:15 -0400</pubDate><source difficult in a country where the security services themselves are trying to emerge from a history as abusers.</p><br clear="all"/></media:text><media:credit role="publishing company"></media:credit></item><item><title>Japan's Olympics minister says Tokyo's 2020 bid was clean</title><description><p><a href="https://news.yahoo.com/japans-olympics-minister-says-tokyos-2020-bid-clean-070816312.html"><img src="https://s1.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/f3H9dTZw4fIOgj67mo9G9A--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/ap_webfeeds/458b680e86604b8f972639e5d810baeb.jpg" width="130" height="86" alt="FILE - In this Sept. 7, 2013, file photo, Japan&#039;s Prime Minister Shinzo Abe, center, shakes hands with President of the International Olympic Committee Jacques Rogge as Tokyo 2020 Olympic Bid Committee President Tsunekazu Takeda stands by after signing the Host City Contract for the 2020 Olympic Games in Buenos Aires, Argentina. A shell company in Singapore is increasingly emerging at the heart of what French prosecutors believe was an organized web of corruption in sports, with their suspicions now extending to Tokyo’s winning bid for the 2020 Olympics. (AP Photo/Natacha Pisarenko, File)" align="left" title="FILE - In this Sept. 7, 2013, file photo, Japan&#039;s Prime Minister Shinzo Abe, center, shakes hands with President of the International Olympic Committee Jacques Rogge as Tokyo 2020 Olympic Bid Committee President Tsunekazu Takeda stands by after signing the Host City Contract for the 2020 Olympic Games in Buenos Aires, Argentina. A shell company in Singapore is increasingly emerging at the heart of what French prosecutors believe was an organized web of corruption in sports, with their suspicions now extending to Tokyo’s winning bid for the 2020 Olympics. (AP Photo/Natacha Pisarenko, File)" border="0" /></a>TOKYO (AP) — Japan&#039;s Olympics Minister said on Friday he believes Tokyo&#039;s bid to host the 2020 Olympics was fair, despite fresh allegations of bribery.</p><br clear="all"/></description><link>https://news.yahoo.com/japans-olympics-minister-says-tokyos-2020-bid-clean-070816312.html</link><pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 03:08:16 -0400</pubDate><source url="http://www.ap.org/">Associated Press</source><guid isPermaLink="false">japans-olympics-minister-says-tokyos-2020-bid-clean-070816312</guid><media:content url="https://s1.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/f3H9dTZw4fIOgj67mo9G9A--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/ap_webfeeds/458b680e86604b8f972639e5d810baeb.jpg" type="image/jpeg" width="130" height="86"></media:content><media:text type="html"><p><a href="https://news.yahoo.com/japans-olympics-minister-says-tokyos-2020-bid-clean-070816312.html"><img src="https://s1.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/f3H9dTZw4fIOgj67mo9G9A--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/ap_webfeeds/458b680e86604b8f972639e5d810baeb.jpg" width="130" height="86" alt="FILE - In this Sept. 7, 2013, file photo, Japan&#039;s Prime Minister Shinzo Abe, center, shakes hands with President of the International Olympic Committee Jacques Rogge as Tokyo 2020 Olympic Bid Committee President Tsunekazu Takeda stands by after signing the Host City Contract for the 2020 Olympic Games in Buenos Aires, Argentina. A shell company in Singapore is increasingly emerging at the heart of what French prosecutors believe was an organized web of corruption in sports, with their suspicions now extending to Tokyo’s winning bid for the 2020 Olympics. (AP Photo/Natacha Pisarenko, File)" align="left" title="FILE - In this Sept. 7, 2013, file photo, Japan&#039;s Prime Minister Shinzo Abe, center, shakes hands with President of the International Olympic Committee Jacques Rogge as Tokyo 2020 Olympic Bid Committee President Tsunekazu Takeda stands by after signing the Host City Contract for the 2020 Olympic Games in Buenos Aires, Argentina. A shell company in Singapore is increasingly emerging at the heart of what French prosecutors believe was an organized web of corruption in sports, with their suspicions now extending to Tokyo’s winning bid for the 2020 Olympics. (AP Photo/Natacha Pisarenko, File)" border="0" /></a>TOKYO (AP) — Japan&#039;s Olympics Minister said on Friday he believes Tokyo&#039;s bid to host the 2020 Olympics was fair, despite fresh allegations of bribery.</p><br clear="all"/></media:text><media:credit role="publishing company"></media:credit></item><item><title>Suicide bombing in northern Iraq kills four security personnel, sources say</title><description>BAGHDAD (Reuters) - Four security personnel died when a suicide bomber detonated his explosive vest in an outdoor vegetable market in northern Iraq on Friday after police and Shi'ite Muslim militia members tried to approach him, intelligence and hospital sources said. The security forces are on high alert following a shooting overnight at a nearby cafe in Balad, 80 km (50 miles) north of Baghdad, that left at least 12 people dead. (Reporting by Ghazwan Hassan; editing by Susan Thomas)</description><link>https://news.yahoo.com/suicide-bombing-northern-iraq-kills-four-security-personnel-070559673.html</link><pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 03:05:59 -0400</pubDate><source url="http://www.reuters.com/">Reuters</source><guid isPermaLink="false">suicide-bombing-northern-iraq-kills-four-security-personnel-070559673</guid></item><item><title>Top Asian News 7:04 a.m. GMT</title><description>SHANGHAI (AP) — An investigation by The Associated Press has found that the president of an influential anti-counterfeiting group owns Alibaba stock, has close ties to a key Alibaba vice president and uses family members to run his coalition. At issue is the independence of the small but influential International Anti-Counterfeiting Coalition, which lobbies U.S. officials and testifies before Congress. The coalition recently admitted Alibaba as a member, prompting companies including Gucci America and Tiffany to quit. Critics consider the Chinese e-commerce giant the world's largest marketplace for fakes. A former member of the coalition's board said she hadn't known that its president, Robert Barchiesi, owned Alibaba stock.</description><link>https://news.yahoo.com/top-asian-news-4-02-m-gmt-040216152.html</link><pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 03:04:54 -0400</pubDate><source url="http://www.ap.org/">Associated Press</source><guid isPermaLink="false">top-asian-news-4-02-m-gmt-040216152</guid></item><item><title>Hezbollah military chief killed in blow to Damascus regime</title><description><p><a href="https://news.yahoo.com/hezbollah-announces-death-top-military-commander-syria-034557134.html"><img src="https://s1.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/1rOxhyG2ZBvgEBmEHt2sMw--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/afp.com/Part-NIC-Nic6451390-1-1-0.jpg" width="130" height="86" alt="Picture released by the Hezbollah press office shows a Hezbollah fighter reportedly erecting the group&#039;s flag in the Tallet Moussa area on the Syrian side of the Qalamun hills close to the Lebanese border" align="left" title="Picture released by the Hezbollah press office shows a Hezbollah fighter reportedly erecting the group&#039;s flag in the Tallet Moussa area on the Syrian side of the Qalamun hills close to the Lebanese border" border="0" /></a>Lebanese militant group Hezbollah announced on Friday that its top military commander had been killed in an attack in Syria in a major blow to the coalition supporting the Damascus regime. The group said it was still investigating the cause of the blast near Damascus airport but it did not immediately point the finger at Israel as it did when the commander&#039;s predecessor was assassinated in the Syrian capital in 2008. The death of Mustafa Badreddine, who had led Hezbollah&#039;s massive intervention in Syria in support of President Bashar al-Assad&#039;s regime, came as a fragile truce in the country&#039;s five-year conflict teetered on the brink of collapse.</p><br clear="all"/></description><link>https://news.yahoo.com/hezbollah-announces-death-top-military-commander-syria-034557134.html</link><pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 03:01:45 -0400</pubDate><source url="http://www.afp.com/">AFP</source><guid isPermaLink="false">hezbollah-announces-death-top-military-commander-syria-034557134</guid><media:content url="https://s1.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/1rOxhyG2ZBvgEBmEHt2sMw--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/afp.com/Part-NIC-Nic6451390-1-1-0.jpg" type="image/jpeg" width="130" height="86"></media:content><media:text type="html"><p><a href="https://news.yahoo.com/hezbollah-announces-death-top-military-commander-syria-034557134.html"><img src="https://s1.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/1rOxhyG2ZBvgEBmEHt2sMw--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/afp.com/Part-NIC-Nic6451390-1-1-0.jpg" width="130" height="86" alt="Picture released by the Hezbollah press office shows a Hezbollah fighter reportedly erecting the group&#039;s flag in the Tallet Moussa area on the Syrian side of the Qalamun hills close to the Lebanese border" align="left" title="Picture released by the Hezbollah press office shows a Hezbollah fighter reportedly erecting the group&#039;s flag in the Tallet Moussa area on the Syrian side of the Qalamun hills close to the Lebanese border" border="0" /></a>Lebanese militant group Hezbollah announced on Friday that its top military commander had been killed in an attack in Syria in a major blow to the coalition supporting the Damascus regime. The group said it was still investigating the cause of the blast near Damascus airport but it did not immediately point the finger at Israel as it did when the commander&#039;s predecessor was assassinated in the Syrian capital in 2008. The death of Mustafa Badreddine, who had led Hezbollah&#039;s massive intervention in Syria in support of President Bashar al-Assad&#039;s regime, came as a fragile truce in the country&#039;s five-year conflict teetered on the brink of collapse.</p><br clear="all"/></media:text><media:credit role="publishing company"></media:credit></item><item><title>AP Investigation: President of anti-fakes group in storm over admitting Alibaba owns company stock, has ties to key VP</title><description>SHANGHAI (AP) — AP Investigation: President of anti-fakes group in storm over admitting Alibaba owns company stock, has ties to key VP.</description><link>https://news.yahoo.com/ap-investigation-president-anti-fakes-group-storm-over-070136464.html</link><pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 03:01:35 -0400</pubDate><source url="http://www.ap.org/">Associated Press</source><guid isPermaLink="false">ap-investigation-president-anti-fakes-group-storm-over-070136464</guid></item><item><title>Turkey: 8 soldiers dead in clash with PKK, helicopter crash</title><description>ANKARA, Turkey (AP) — Eight Turkish military personnel have died in clashes with Kurdish rebels and in a subsequent helicopter crash near the country's border with Iraq, Turkey's military said Friday. Japan&#039;s announcement comes after French prosecutors said they suspect that $2 million paid to a son of disgraced former world athletics supremo Lamine Diack was aimed at winning support for the Tokyo 2020 bid. &quot;We will further work to confirm facts,&quot; top Japanese government spokesman Yoshihide Suga told a regular press conference, citing the French probe.</p><br clear="all"/></description><link>https://news.yahoo.com/japan-confirm-facts-over-olympic-payment-claim-050415568--oly.html</link><pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 02:34:11 -0400</pubDate><source url="http://www.afp.com/">AFP</source><guid isPermaLink="false">japan-confirm-facts-over-olympic-payment-claim-050415568--oly</guid><media:content url="https://s1.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/K.tDc51zmsxKPG2nW2Q5nA--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/afp.com/Part-HKG-Hkg10125866-1-1-0.jpg" type="image/jpeg" width="130" height="86"></media:content><media:text type="html"><p><a href="https://news.yahoo.com/japan-confirm-facts-over-olympic-payment-claim-050415568--oly.html"><img src="https://s1.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/K.tDc51zmsxKPG2nW2Q5nA--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/afp.com/Part-HKG-Hkg10125866-1-1-0.jpg" width="130" height="86" alt="The International Olympic Committee chose Tokyo over Istanbul and Madrid as host for the 2020 Games" align="left" title="The International Olympic Committee chose Tokyo over Istanbul and Madrid as host for the 2020 Games" border="0" /></a>Japan on Friday said it would question officials involved in Tokyo&#039;s successful 2020 Olympics bid over a multi-million dollar payment which is being probed by French investigators. Japan&#039;s announcement comes after French prosecutors said they suspect that $2 million paid to a son of disgraced former world athletics supremo Lamine Diack was aimed at winning support for the Tokyo 2020 bid. &quot;We will further work to confirm facts,&quot; top Japanese government spokesman Yoshihide Suga told a regular press conference, citing the French probe.</p><br clear="all"/></media:text><media:credit role="publishing company"></media:credit></item><item><title>Rural midwives on front line of Sierra Leone maternity crisis</title><description><p><a href="https://news.yahoo.com/rural-midwives-front-line-sierra-leone-maternity-crisis-061819098.html"><img src="https://s1.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/VLmNW_qVhiKYPDN9OIFGHQ--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/afp.com/2486965a9cc5f3d34ed7d6d34043eba54e76de04.jpg" width="130" height="86" alt="Students at the Masuba Midwifery School in Sierra Leone practice cardiopulmonary resuscitation on a dummy" align="left" title="Students at the Masuba Midwifery School in Sierra Leone practice cardiopulmonary resuscitation on a dummy" border="0" /></a>It is final exams season at Masuba midwifery school in rural Sierra Leone, and 70 more students are about to begin working life at the sharp end of the country&#039;s maternal health crisis. Established in 2010, the school is only the second dedicated midwife training unit for a country of seven million people, located at the end of a bone-shaking series of dirt tracks several hours from the capital by car. &quot;My first placement where I was sent in Kabala (a northern town)... people don&#039;t believe in the hospital facility,&quot; said Aminata Kanu, sitting in her classroom with dozens of others in identical blue uniforms and white hats.</p><br clear="all"/></description><link>https://news.yahoo.com/rural-midwives-front-line-sierra-leone-maternity-crisis-061819098.html</link><pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 02:18:19 -0400</pubDate><source url="http://www.afp.com/">AFP</source><guid isPermaLink="false">rural-midwives-front-line-sierra-leone-maternity-crisis-061819098</guid><media:content url="https://s1.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/VLmNW_qVhiKYPDN9OIFGHQ--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/afp.com/2486965a9cc5f3d34ed7d6d34043eba54e76de04.jpg" type="image/jpeg" width="130" height="86"></media:content><media:text type="html"><p><a href="https://news.yahoo.com/rural-midwives-front-line-sierra-leone-maternity-crisis-061819098.html"><img src="https://s1.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/VLmNW_qVhiKYPDN9OIFGHQ--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/afp.com/2486965a9cc5f3d34ed7d6d34043eba54e76de04.jpg" width="130" height="86" alt="Students at the Masuba Midwifery School in Sierra Leone practice cardiopulmonary resuscitation on a dummy" align="left" title="Students at the Masuba Midwifery School in Sierra Leone practice cardiopulmonary resuscitation on a dummy" border="0" /></a>It is final exams season at Masuba midwifery school in rural Sierra Leone, and 70 more students are about to begin working life at the sharp end of the country&#039;s maternal health crisis. Established in 2010, the school is only the second dedicated midwife training unit for a country of seven million people, located at the end of a bone-shaking series of dirt tracks several hours from the capital by car. &quot;My first placement where I was sent in Kabala (a northern town)... people don&#039;t believe in the hospital facility,&quot; said Aminata Kanu, sitting in her classroom with dozens of others in identical blue uniforms and white hats.</p><br clear="all"/></media:text><media:credit role="publishing company"></media:credit></item><item><title>Long road to recovery for the victims of Iraq bombings</title><description><p><a href="https://news.yahoo.com/long-road-recovery-victims-iraq-061747592.html"><img src="https://s1.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/dq_ySq6mDI4y8RyDEsiYDg--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/ap_webfeeds/f7d0eac504b9464d80bc500b1e7f2860.jpg" width="130" height="86" alt="In this Wednesday, May 4, 2016 photo, national flags, flowers and balls surround the poster of Muhannad Khazaal, 6, at the soccer field where he died in the March bombing of a football game in in Iskandariyah, 25 miles (about 40 kilometers) south of Baghdad, Iraq. Should Turnbull be returned as prime minister, the verdict clears the path after several years of key policies being rejected by the upper house.</p><br clear="all"/></media:text><media:credit role="publishing company"></media:credit></item><item><title>Solar Impulse 2 lands in Oklahoma on record-breaking flight</title><description><p><a href="https://news.yahoo.com/solar-impulse-2-leaves-arizona-record-breaking-flight-102809622.html"><img src="https://s.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/mxW.eiq6q5nTfOw7DxHjAg--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/afp.com/207808aa09266f1e34429c05c9d70ce495f7ae06.jpg" width="130" height="86" alt="Solar Impulse 2, piloted by Swiss adventurer Bertrand Piccard, landed at Tulsa International Airport after taking off from Phoenix, Arizona" align="left" title="Solar Impulse 2, piloted by Swiss adventurer Bertrand Piccard, landed at Tulsa International Airport after taking off from Phoenix, Arizona" border="0" /></a>The Solar Impulse 2 plane touched down in Tulsa, in the south-central US state of Oklahoma, ending the latest stage of its record-breaking quest to circle the globe without consuming a drop of fuel. The experimental solar-powered aircraft, aimed at promoting clean energy technologies, landed at 11:17 pm local time (0417 GMT) at Tulsa International Airport after taking off at 3:00 am (1000 GMT) from Phoenix, Arizona, live feed showed. Piloted by Swiss adventurer Bertrand Piccard, the flight lasted just over 18 hours 15 minutes.</p><br clear="all"/></description><link>https://news.yahoo.com/solar-impulse-2-leaves-arizona-record-breaking-flight-102809622.html</link><pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 01:13:03 -0400</pubDate><source url="http://www.afp.com/">AFP</source><guid isPermaLink="false">solar-impulse-2-leaves-arizona-record-breaking-flight-102809622</guid><media:content url="https://s.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/mxW.eiq6q5nTfOw7DxHjAg--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/afp.com/207808aa09266f1e34429c05c9d70ce495f7ae06.jpg" type="image/jpeg" width="130" height="86"></media:content><media:text type="html"><p><a href="https://news.yahoo.com/solar-impulse-2-leaves-arizona-record-breaking-flight-102809622.html"><img src="https://s.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/mxW.eiq6q5nTfOw7DxHjAg--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/afp.com/207808aa09266f1e34429c05c9d70ce495f7ae06.jpg" width="130" height="86" alt="Solar Impulse 2, piloted by Swiss adventurer Bertrand Piccard, landed at Tulsa International Airport after taking off from Phoenix, Arizona" align="left" title="Solar Impulse 2, piloted by Swiss adventurer Bertrand Piccard, landed at Tulsa International Airport after taking off from Phoenix, Arizona" border="0" /></a>The Solar Impulse 2 plane touched down in Tulsa, in the south-central US state of Oklahoma, ending the latest stage of its record-breaking quest to circle the globe without consuming a drop of fuel. Piloted by Swiss adventurer Bertrand Piccard, the flight lasted just over 18 hours 15 minutes.</p><br clear="all"/></media:text><media:credit role="publishing company"></media:credit></item><item><title>Lucas Browne stripped of WBA heavyweight title, suspended</title><description>SYDNEY (AP) — The World Boxing Association has stripped Australian Lucas Browne of his heavyweight title and suspended him for six months after his B sample on a doping test also returned a positive finding.</description><link>https://news.yahoo.com/lucas-browne-stripped-wba-heavyweight-title-suspended-041500848.html</link><pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 00:36:06 -0400</pubDate><source url="http://www.ap.org/">Associated Press</source><guid isPermaLink="false">lucas-browne-stripped-wba-heavyweight-title-suspended-041500848</guid></item><item><title>A dance to the music of Mao: China's Cultural Revolution art</title><description><p><a href="https://news.yahoo.com/dance-music-mao-chinas-cultural-revolution-art-043053807.html"><img src="https://s.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/v.zfgR6czXvyP7VAEnDsPA--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/afp.com/ea72db80af33b1d9e4c32480b7d699ba98056c91.jpg" width="130" height="86" alt="Performers dancing and singing during a Chinese national opera of the &quot;Red Detachment of Women&quot; in Haikou, south China&#039;s Hainan province" align="left" title="Performers dancing and singing during a Chinese national opera of the &quot;Red Detachment of Women&quot; in Haikou, south China&#039;s Hainan province" border="0" /></a>When the critical eye of Mao Zedong&#039;s wife fell upon a non-conforming artist during China&#039;s Cultural Revolution the assessment could be devastating. (Maslin Family/Australian Department of Foreign Affairs and Trade via AP) MANDATORY CREDIT" border="0" /></a>SYDNEY (AP) — An Australian couple whose three children were killed in the downing of Malaysia Airlines Flight 17 over Ukraine two years ago has welcomed a new baby, saying the birth has given them faith that love trumps hate.</p><br clear="all"/></media:text><media:credit role="publishing company"></media:credit></item><item><title>Security worker dies at Australian Embassy in Baghdad</title><description>SYDNEY (AP) — An Australian security contractor working at the Australian Embassy in Baghdad has died, officials said Friday.</description><link>https://news.yahoo.com/security-worker-dies-australian-embassy-baghdad-014658517.html</link><pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 00:01:32 -0400</pubDate><source url="http://www.ap.org/">Associated Press</source><guid isPermaLink="false">security-worker-dies-australian-embassy-baghdad-014658517</guid></item><item><title>Dominican Republic president seems destined for re-election</title><description>SANTO DOMINGO, Dominican Republic (AP) — President Danilo Medina squeaked into his first term in a close election in 2012, and soon faced violent protests over his party's handling of the economy. He was barred by the Dominican Republic's constitution from running for s second straight term.</description><link>https://news.yahoo.com/dominican-republic-president-seems-destined-election-040113866.html</link><pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2016 00:01:13 -0400</pubDate><source url="http://www.ap.org/">Associated Press</source><guid isPermaLink="false">dominican-republic-president-seems-destined-election-040113866</guid></item><item><title>Turkey visa deal unravels as Erdogan defies EU on key condition</title><description><p><a href="https://news.yahoo.com/erdogan-refuses-bow-key-condition-visas-101135321.html"><img src="https://s1.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/c1F1Pttxy4LO0yA7cD05ag--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/afp.com/f38846caacdbaa2c6422f9ad5df507a2b4a6585f.jpg" width="130" height="86" alt="Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdoga has accused the EU of hypocrisy" align="left" title="Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdoga has accused the EU of hypocrisy" border="0" /></a>A deal to grant Turks visa-free travel to most of the European Union was hanging by a thread after President Recep Tayyip Erdogan defiantly vowed Ankara would not fulfil a key condition set by Brussels. With alarm growing over the deal&#039;s future, European Commission chief Jean-Claude Juncker bluntly told Erdogan that Turks would only enjoy travel to the passport-free Schengen area if all conditions were met and it would be &quot;his problem&quot; if this failed to materialise. The promise of visa-free travel is a key pillar of the landmark March accord for Turkey to stem the flow of migrants to the EU and this could now also be in peril.</p><br clear="all"/></description><link>https://news.yahoo.com/erdogan-refuses-bow-key-condition-visas-101135321.html</link><pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 23:56:31 -0400</pubDate><source url="http://www.afp.com/">AFP</source><guid isPermaLink="false">erdogan-refuses-bow-key-condition-visas-101135321</guid><media:content url="https://s1.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/c1F1Pttxy4LO0yA7cD05ag--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/afp.com/f38846caacdbaa2c6422f9ad5df507a2b4a6585f.jpg" type="image/jpeg" width="130" height="86"></media:content><media:text type="html"><p><a href="https://news.yahoo.com/erdogan-refuses-bow-key-condition-visas-101135321.html"><img src="https://s1.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/c1F1Pttxy4LO0yA7cD05ag--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/afp.com/f38846caacdbaa2c6422f9ad5df507a2b4a6585f.jpg" width="130" height="86" alt="Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdoga has accused the EU of hypocrisy" align="left" title="Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdoga has accused the EU of hypocrisy" border="0" /></a>A deal to grant Turks visa-free travel to most of the European Union was hanging by a thread after President Recep Tayyip Erdogan defiantly vowed Ankara would not fulfil a key condition set by Brussels. With alarm growing over the deal&#039;s future, European Commission chief Jean-Claude Juncker bluntly told Erdogan that Turks would only enjoy travel to the passport-free Schengen area if all conditions were met and it would be &quot;his problem&quot; if this failed to materialise. The promise of visa-free travel is a key pillar of the landmark March accord for Turkey to stem the flow of migrants to the EU and this could now also be in peril.</p><br clear="all"/></media:text><media:credit role="publishing company"></media:credit></item><item><title>Top Asian News 3:56 a.m. GMT</title><description>SYDNEY (AP) — An Australian couple whose three children were killed in the downing of Malaysia Airlines Flight 17 over Ukraine two years ago have welcomed a new baby, saying the birth has given them faith that love trumps hate. Anthony Maslin and Marite Norris, of the western Australian city of Perth, said the arrival of their daughter Violet May Maslin on Tuesday had brought them "love and light, hope and joy" after enduring two years of grief over the loss of their three children. Mo, 12, Evie, 10, and Otis, 8, died along with their grandfather, Nick Norris, when Flight 17 was shot down by a missile over eastern Ukraine in July 2014.</description><link>https://news.yahoo.com/top-asian-news-4-17-m-gmt-041724748.html</link><pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 23:56:06 -0400</pubDate><source url="http://www.ap.org/">Associated Press</source><guid isPermaLink="false">top-asian-news-4-17-m-gmt-041724748</guid></item><item><title>US ready to loosen Libya arms embargo: US official</title><description><p><a href="https://news.yahoo.com/us-ready-loosen-libya-arms-embargo-us-official-030301974.html"><img src="https://s.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/Z9GHpYemjnJXOZuaX46pKw--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/afp.com/04ae79b0bfd1455554dcf6bf2300a242dc4bfca4.jpg" width="130" height="86" alt="Libyans demonstrate in Benghazi calling for military forces to re-capture the southern city of Sirte from the Islamic State group without foreign intervention" align="left" title="Libyans demonstrate in Benghazi calling for military forces to re-capture the southern city of Sirte from the Islamic State group without foreign intervention" border="0" /></a>The US government is ready to loosen a ban on arms exports to Libya, in a bid to help the country&#039;s fledgling unity government fight the Islamic State group, officials and diplomats told AFP. Under White House-backed plans, the United Nations would carve out exemptions to an embargo introduced by the Security Council in 2011, during Moamer Kadhafi&#039;s failed attempt to suppress a popular uprising. &quot;If the Libyan government prepares a detailed and coherent list of things that it wants to use to fight ISIL and responds to all the requirements of the exemption, I think that Council members are going to look very seriously at that request,&quot; a senior administration official told AFP.</p><br clear="all"/></description><link>https://news.yahoo.com/us-ready-loosen-libya-arms-embargo-us-official-030301974.html</link><pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 23:52:29 -0400</pubDate><source url="http://www.afp.com/">AFP</source><guid isPermaLink="false">us-ready-loosen-libya-arms-embargo-us-official-030301974</guid><media:content url="https://s.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/Z9GHpYemjnJXOZuaX46pKw--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/afp.com/04ae79b0bfd1455554dcf6bf2300a242dc4bfca4.jpg" type="image/jpeg" width="130" height="86"></media:content><media:text type="html"><p><a href="https://news.yahoo.com/us-ready-loosen-libya-arms-embargo-us-official-030301974.html"><img src="https://s.yimg.com/bt/api/res/1.2/Z9GHpYemjnJXOZuaX46pKw--/YXBwaWQ9eW5ld3NfbGVnbztmaT1maWxsO2g9ODY7cT03NTt3PTEzMA--/http://media.zenfs.com/en_us/News/afp.com/04ae79b0bfd1455554dcf6bf2300a242dc4bfca4.jpg" width="130" height="86" alt="Libyans demonstrate in Benghazi calling for military forces to re-capture the southern city of Sirte from the Islamic State group without foreign intervention" align="left" title="Libyans demonstrate in Benghazi calling for military forces to re-capture the southern city of Sirte from the Islamic State group without foreign intervention" border="0" /></a>The US government is ready to loosen a ban on arms exports to Libya, in a bid to help the country&#039;s fledgling unity government fight the Islamic State group, officials and diplomats told AFP. Under White House-backed plans, the United Nations would carve out exemptions to an embargo introduced by the Security Council in 2011, during Moamer Kadhafi&#039;s failed attempt to suppress a popular uprising. &quot;If the Libyan government prepares a detailed and coherent list of things that it wants to use to fight ISIL and responds to all the requirements of the exemption, I think that Council members are going to look very seriously at that request,&quot; a senior administration official told AFP.</p><br clear="all"/></media:text><media:credit role="publishing company"></media:credit></item><item><title>Apple invests $1 billion in Chinese ride-hailing company</title><description>BEIJING (AP) — Apple Inc. has invested $1 billion in Chinese ride-hailing service Didi Chuxing, which is in intense competition with Uber Technologies Ltd. for users.</description><link>https://news.yahoo.com/apple-invests-1-billion-chinese-ride-hailing-company-034452265--finance.html</link><pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 23:44:53 -0400</pubDate><source url="http://www.ap.org/">Associated Press</source><guid isPermaLink="false">apple-invests-1-billion-chinese-ride-hailing-company-034452265--finance</guid></item><item><title>Tomic says he won't play for Australia at Rio Olympics</title><description>SYDNEY (AP) — Bernard Tomic has ruled himself out of representing Australia at the Rio de Janeiro Olympics, saying on Friday that a busy playing schedule and personal circumstances were behind the decision.</description><link>https://news.yahoo.com/tomic-says-wont-play-australia-rio-olympics-212506024.html</link><pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2016 23:33:05 -0400</pubDate><source url="http://www.ap.org/">Associated Press</source><guid isPermaLink="false">tomic-says-wont-play-australia-rio-olympics-212506024</guid></item></channel>
